sentences.chinese: 預見到會有虧損，雍容大度地接受虧損。

sentences.english: We have touched that place of Grace and shared with each other our excellences .
sentences.chinese: 我們接觸了雍容之處和互相分享我們的卓越。

sentences.english: Lamp holder, lamp post moderate size, color and delicate, grace appearance modeling.
sentences.chinese: 燈頭，燈杆粗細適中，色彩調和雅緻，造型雍容大方。

sentences.english: Merry and clear shape likes a radiant and graceful waltz in royal palace.
sentences.chinese: 有着歡快明朗的造型，似雍容華貴的宮殿圓舞曲。

sentences.english: The regal lady had made a deep impression on him.
sentences.chinese: 那位雍容華貴的婦人給他留下了深刻的印象。

sentences.english: Demonstrate grace and elegant style of bone china, elegant fashion features.
sentences.chinese: 彰顯骨質瓷雍容典雅之風格，高貴時尚之特點。

sentences.english: The writing style of the Imperial Ministries was prevalent throughout the first part of the Ming dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 雍容平正的臺閣文風盛行於明代前期。

sentences.english: Rich and magnificent dresses make middle-aged women more elegant.
sentences.chinese: 雍容華麗的服裝，使中年女子更富情韻。

sentences.english: This courtyard-style hotel offers the comforts of western amenities in a traditional Chinese setting.
sentences.chinese: 這是座庭院式酒店，提供的舒適雍容的中國傳統客房。

sentences.english: And all that's best of dark and bright meet in her aspect and her eyes;
sentences.chinese: 所有的光明和黑暗交相輝映出她的雍容和溫柔的眼波。

sentences.english: This magnificent view shows the multihued beauty of the Adirondacks, a mountain range located in the northeastern part of New York.
sentences.chinese: 這個宏偉的視圖顯示了阿迪朗達克山脈的雍容華貴。

definition: lucid and elegant/quiet and exquisite/clear and attractive style
